content: vee socks for me socks pattern by kimberly lewis a woven and spun creation a toe up v_stitch sock using and afterthought heel yarn used magic stripes by lion brand hook used e 2 stitch markers stitches used v_stitch - half_double_crochet ch1 half_double_crochet in stitch or space indicated shell pattern - 5 double_crochet in stitch or space indicated skip next stitch single_crochet in next stitch skip next stitch 5 double_crochet in next stitch continue around fpdc - front post double chain crochet bpdc - back post double chain crochet chain 10 work bottom bump back loop of chain with a slip_stitch in 3rd chain from hook and in each chain across this will help reinforce the toe area once to the end single_crochet down the other side of the beginning chain 3 single_crochet in the last stitch to make the corner mark 2nd stitch in series with stitch marker single_crochet in each stitch around to last stitch 3 single_crochet in last stitch mark 2nd stitch in series with stitch marker continue this pattern increasing 3 stitches in each corner stitch increase until you have 25 stitches for a size 5 shoe 29 stitches for a size 6 shoe 35 stitches for a size 7 shoe 39 stitches for a size 8 shoe 45 stitches for a size 9 shoe after this you will no longer need the stitch markers work v_stitch in next single_crochet skip single_crochet work v_stitch in next single_crochet around do not join once you have a completed one round of v stitches continue to work v_stitch in the chain 1 space of the previous v stitches work pattern until you are approx 2 inches less then the size of your foot for a size 7 foot 20 row of v stitches worked well mark side of sock with stitch marker continue v_stitch pattern to the other side of sock you have now defined the front or top part of sock chain 24 and join with v_stitch where your marker is continue v_stitch pattern across front of sock when you reach the chain area *skip 2 chain v_stitch in next chain skip 2 chain v stitch in next chain* repeat from * to * until you reach the stitch marker resume v stitch pattern around for a total of 5 rounds double_crochet in each hdch do not double_crochet in the chain 1 space continue around you should end with an even number of stitches * fpdc in next double_crochet bpdc in next double_crochet * continue pattern from * to * around in next round fpdc in each fpdc and bpdc in each bpdc around continue for 5 rounds or more if you want a longer sock this creates a ribbing pattern end sock with a shell edging 5 double_crochet in next stitch skip stitch single_crochet in next stitch skip stitch and continue shell pattern around finish off and weave in end for heel single_crochet in corner area of heel and in each half_double_crochet and chain around
